<|end_tools|>

"quest_giver," he always said, "quest_giver, who knows the road better than old character_0?" But the highways just aren't as safe as they once were and there hasn't been a messenger from location_0 here in months.
Could you keep your eyes open along the southern roads and let me know if you find anything?
<|end_description|>

Keep whatever you don't use and I'll give you an extra number_0 gold pieces if you bring back my husband's old boots that he keeps down there. If you bring back one of their bodies and my ol' bottle of wine as well, I might toss in a little something extra too.

<|end_objective|>
<|begin_tasks|>
find the lycanthropes' lair and quest_giver's spellbook within it
<|end_tasks|>
<|begin_task_locations|>
character_0's ship
<|end_task_locations|>
<|begin_quest_giver|>
quest_giver: an elven mage who was a guide to character_0
<|end_quest_giver|>
<|begin_rewards|>
a way out of this island
<|end_rewards|>
<|begin_characters|>
character_0: a legendary hero of old
character_1: the goddess of the moon
<|end_characters|>
<|begin_groups|>
lycanthropes, werewolves
<|end_groups|>
<|begin_tools|>
quest_giver converted to the Church of character_1 recently
there are werewolves everywhere
quest_giver might find a way out of this island if his spellbook was returned to him
<|end_tools|>
<|begin_description|>
I am quest_giver, mage and recent convert to the Church of character_1.
I was the guide for character_0's brave adventures to the ends of the world and beyond. The wolf-men are everywhere. The lycanthropes' lair is in character_0's ship. My spellbook lies within. With it, I am a powerful mage. Without it, I am the pauper that stands before you. With my spellbook retrieved, I may be able to discover a way off of the island.
If you go to destroy the lycanthropes' lair, I would ask that you find my book.
<|end_description|>
<|end_quest|>

<|begin_quest|>
<|begin_objective|>
discover what's been happening with the disappearing citizens, and come see quest_giver
<|end_objective|>
<|begin_tasks|>

<|end_tasks|>
<|begin_task_locations|>
the east of the city
<|end_task_locations|>
<|begin_quest_giver|>

<|end_quest_giver|>
<|begin_rewards|>
number_0 gold in advance
number_1 gold bonus
<|end_rewards|>
<|begin_groups|>
group_0: a mercenary organization promoting order and law
<|end_groups|>
<|begin_tools|>
quest_giver knows the player
every night people have been disappearing from the streets of the city
possible tracks of a many-legged centipede-like monster have been found
<|end_tools|>
<|begin_description|>
It is I, quest_giver, second-in-command of the group_0. I have another job you might be interested in. You'll be well paid for your services.
The problem is this: Every night people have been disappearing from the streets of the city. My men have been scouring the city trying to find the culprit, but so far to no avail. People have begun to get scared, and very few are willing to leave their homes at night. Something has to be done, and quickly. Would you be willing to take the job? I'd pay you number_0 gold in advance with a number_1 gold bonus if you discover what's been happening with the disappearing citizens.
Your job is really simple. All I want you to do is patrol the east of the city and find an entrance to the sewers. Perhaps you'll get lucky and find out what's been happening. If you do find out what's been happening, come to see me at the group_0 barracks. Our only clue so far has led us to the sewers, so if you want to explore them first, it would probably be a good idea. Also, we've found tracks of some many-legged creature, perhaps a centipede-like monster.
<|end_description|>
<|end_quest|>

<|begin_quest|>
<|begin_objective|>
investigate character_0_0 and character_0_1, and report back to quest_giver
<|end_objective|>
<|begin_tasks|>
go with quest_giver, let him introduce you as his old friend and quarter you in the guest chambers
<|end_tasks|>
<|begin_task_locations|>
group_0 Estate, the headquarters of the group_0
<|end_task_locations|>
<|begin_quest_giver|>
quest_giver: one of the principal shareholders of the group_0
<|end_quest_giver|>
<|begin_rewards|>
NONE
<|end_rewards|>
<|begin_characters|>
character_0_0, character_0_1: quest_giver's business partners, located at the group_0 Estate
<|end_characters|>
<|begin_groups|>
group_0: a business company
<|end_groups|>
<|begin_tools|>
the player saved quest_giver on his hunting trip
quest_giver thinks that character_0_0 and character_0_1 have become different people when he was gone: they spend their and quest_giver's company's resources on frivolous and stupid ideas
<|end_tools|>
<|begin_description|>
It is so pleasant to see your face once again. Don't you recognize me? It is I, quest_giver. I am so glad to have met you, especially at a time like this. I need to speak with you privately.
I'm sorry for all of this hiding and skulking, but there are dire events afoot. You know that I am one of the principal shareholders of the group_0. Well, I share ownership of the company with two others: character_0_0 and character_0_1, two very distinguished gentlemen. When I returned from my hunting trip  thanks to you, I might add  I found that my two partners had undergone some profound changes, nothing physical or overt, but something far more sinister.
It's as if my partners had become wholly different people while I was gone. They almost take an active interest in squandering our company's resources on frivolous and stupid ideas. If they continue on this course, the company will be in shambles in but a few weeks. I know you have already helped me once, but I ask for your assistance again. I have no other recourse.
Come into the group_0 Estate with me. I will explain that you are an old friend of mine and will quarter you in the guest chambers. From there, please investigate my partners, perhaps using magic or any of the other skills you possess. Learn as much as you can during your visit and then report back to me after you're done. It should only take a couple of days.
<|end_description|>
<|end_quest|>

<|begin_quest|>
<|begin_objective|>

<|end_objective|>

<|end_tasks|>
<|begin_task_locations|>
fifty yards to the east
<|end_task_locations|>

<|end_quest_giver|>

number_1 gold pieces
<|end_rewards|>

number_0 ankhegs
<|end_enemies|>
<|begin_tools|>
NONE
<|end_tools|>
<|begin_description|>
I'm quest_giver, a ranger.
You've come here to fight ankhegs? Well, listen up: it's mating season, so it's primarily females coming up to the surface, looking to put on a little extra weight. They're hungry, they're aggressive, and there are a lot of them. Now, the point of this exercise is not to exterminate them, but to keep their population to a manageable level. Remember, they aerate the soil and thereby improve crop yields by as much as 15%. Food is going to be scarce enough in the next few years, so keep that in mind when you're out there. No more than number_0 ankhegs per party. After that it's catch and release, all right? Most of the activity starts about fifty yards to the east.
Now move out, everyone. You'll get number_1 gold pieces, if you stick to the quota.
<|end_description|>
<|end_quest|>

bring a cask of item_0 to quest_giver
<|end_objective|>
<|begin_tasks|>
get the cask from character_0
<|end_tasks|>
<|begin_task_locations|>
task_location_0: a town
<|end_task_locations|>
<|begin_quest_giver|>
quest_giver: a dwarven wild mage
<|end_quest_giver|>
<|begin_rewards|>
quest_giver will pay the player well
<|end_rewards|>
<|begin_characters|>
character_0: a male innkeeper, located at task_location_0
<|end_characters|>
<|begin_items|>
item_0: beer from location_0
<|end_items|>
<|begin_locations|>
location_0: a country
<|end_locations|>
<|begin_tools|>
quest_giver is not good with names
<|end_tools|>
<|begin_description|>
Name's quest_giver. Pleased to see yer face and make its acquaintance. I'm no good with names; if ye can remember mine, ye've already beaten me. I forgot yers by the end of the first syllable.
Maybe it's the wild mage in me comin' out, but I can't stand not tastin' something new once in a while. Most dwarves will drink the same mountain swill from crib to dust-crib, but I'm always hankering for the latest brew. character_0 in task_location_0 was just getting a shipment from location_0 I'd dearly love to sample. If ye happen to run by his place in yer travels, get a cask of it for me and I'll pay ye well!
Can't wait to taste it. item_0, it's called  I hope it works on dwarves, too
<|end_description|>
<|end_quest|>

<|begin_quest|>
<|begin_objective|>
bring the evidence of character_0's corrupt actions to character_1
<|end_objective|>
<|begin_tasks|>
1) investigate character_2
2) find character_0's personal records
<|end_tasks|>
<|begin_task_locations|>
1) the docks
2) character_0's home, northwest of the main government building in the Government District
<|end_task_locations|>
<|begin_quest_giver|>
quest_giver: a guard
<|end_quest_giver|>
<|begin_rewards|>
NONE
<|end_rewards|>
<|begin_characters|>
character_0: a corrupt male guard
character_1: character_0's commander, located at the Government District main building
character_2: a suspicious man, located at the docks
<|end_characters|>
<|begin_tools|>
quest_giver saw character_0 using his authority against the player in a corrupt manner
any complaints about character_0 must first go through him: guards cannot do anything about character_0
character_0's personal records may reveal his fondness for gems
<|end_tools|>
<|begin_description|>
I am quest_giver, a mere guard.
I saw what happened, and I share your helplessness. Any complaints about character_0 must first go THROUGH him, so you can imagine how many get through.
This did not come from me, for if my indiscretion against character_0 were to get out, I should be thrown from the military. There is one way you can get to him.
character_0 is quite corrupt and more than willing to exercise his power. You are not monitored as we, so you can do something that I or another guard cannot.
Look to the docks and a man named character_2. Examine him and what he does, and you are sure to see what I mean. You might also wish to pry into character_0's personal records. They may reveal something of his fondness for gems. I did not tell you this... and I certainly did not say his records are in his home northwest of the main government building in the Government District.
Think on what I've said, and bring anything you learn to character_1 in the Government District main building. He is character_0's commander.
<|end_description|>
<|end_quest|>

You will rescue him. He will be killed once they are through, so go quickly. They have him at the group_0_0 guild house on the second floor. You know the building, I think? The man's name is character_0. Remember, if he dies, you fail.
Good luck.

I've come to ask if you've a chapel that a priest of character_0 might set himself up in... bring the good Word to the folk of the area.
What do you say, eh? If my manner does not strike you as offensive, I would be glad to be chaplain of your wee keep here. I can help your people here much while I stay. But I do not promise to stay for long. Either you accept me or you don't, my liege... that is your choice, and I'll not begrudge it you.

I would not bother you, stranger, but I am in terrible peril! I need your aid! I beg you for a boon or I and my daughter both shall surely perish! I... cannot speak more of this here. Please come to my home on top of the cliff, I beg you! We can speak freely there!
My home is atop the east cliff, adventurer. It is a simple dwelling but... safe, for the moment. My name is quest_giver... please meet me there and I shall explain everything, I swear.

One of the stagers almost died falling out of the rafters!
All the actors are frightened; they believe the curse is assailing us, and I... am beginning to believe it too. Oh, what a fool I was to disregard it!

<|end_rewards|>
<|begin_characters|>

<|end_locations|>

<|begin_description|>
I should begin with my name... quest_giver. I grew up here in location_0.
Things have not always been like this. location_0 was once a pleasant town, though my memories may be influenced by happier times in my own life.
Then the pirates arrived, led by the despot character_3. character_3 had lost a war with another pirate king. Forced to this island, his ships invaded the town. They took our homes. character_3 killed our mayor and dumped his body into the sea. We were forced out into the streets.
My father could take no more injustice. He tried to get back into our house and was executed for breaking the law of the pirates. Once they've stolen something, the owner has no claim on it.
character_3 said that we would have to pay for our father's "crime." He gave us to character_2, his lieutenant, as a reward for service. He put me to work as a courtesan for the drunken pirates. It's horrible, traveler! He says that he'll kill my brother character_1 if I don't do it.
There is no escape for character_1 and me. There is a smuggler who will take us, but we cannot afford to pay him. There is nowhere to run on this island.
character_2 can be found near the inn. The smuggler's name is character_0. I hope that character_0 will take us with him when you kill character_2. He will be near the docks. Please be careful!

I shall give you the key, then, which will allow you into the tomb... the key itself having been in my family for some time as well. More proof, yes? Go, then, and return with the mantle.

<|end_rewards|>

<|begin_description|>
quest_giver at your service. I would normally invite you to look at my magical wares, but alas, my shelves are completely bare. I have not even a single parchment left for you to purchase.
My spellbook has been stolen! Without it, I cannot fashion the powerful scrolls which normally fill my shop. Please, mighty traveler... I beg of you to help a humble wizard! At first, I suspected character_0... he is well known about town for his sticky fingers. But after questioning many witnesses, it is clear that character_0 was at the local pub from dusk until dawn the night of the theft. I still suspect that no-good thief character_0 was involved  I can clearly see the guilt in his face! But there is no proof. Without my spellbook, I am virtually powerless to pursue this myself, and as a newcomer to this town, I have no one to turn to for help.
I regret that there is little else I can tell you. character_0 can usually be found in the task_location_0 if you wish to question him.
I urge you godspeed.

There is no way to open that entrance from the outside. But character_0 is a faithful soldier, not the type of man to betray location_0.

We didn't get a chance to complete our investigations. character_1, the son of the character_3, disappeared. He was our primary witness. <|begin_quest|>
<|begin_objective|>
bring the the item_0 to the book collector
<|end_objective|>
<|begin_tasks|>
find the item_0 with quest_giver
<|end_tasks|>
<|begin_task_locations|>
a tomb over in the lower crypts of the Graveyard District
<|end_task_locations|>
<|begin_quest_giver|>
quest_giver: a powerful warrior
<|end_quest_giver|>
<|begin_rewards|>
sacks of loot and odd magics
<|end_rewards|>
<|begin_characters|>
book collector, a man
<|end_characters|>
<|begin_items|>
item_0: a grimoire
<|end_items|>
<|begin_tools|>
quest_giver and his fellows were on a mission to obtain the item_0 for a book collector
quest_giver and his fellows had a heated argument: only quest_giver remained alive afterwards
<|end_tools|>
<|begin_description|>
I'm scouring for a band of desperate adventurers to aid me in a gallant task. Come and hear quest_giver's tale!
A fortnight past, me fellows and I were in the midst of obtaining an ancient text fer our patron when a skirmish visited our midst. Vile words, alas, became a lake of bloodshed. So it goes the sacred grimoire ne'er made it to our benefactor's hand. And now he awaits its arrival with a zeal reserved for a grog-blossom in an alekeg. The scuttlebutt is the pay is handsome and worthy of note  sacks of loot and odd magics. The volume sits not far from 'ere, and the bibliomaniac, he paces the floor in the meantime. 'Tis called the item_0.
The item_0 is in some hobnail's tomb over in the lower crypts of the Graveyard District. It's nae abandoned, but rumors and half-truths only scare the young and infirm. Keeps the curious away, me guess.
Well... it'll take far more than a few shambling bags of skin and stitches to deter quest_giver from a king's ransom! A foolhardy jaunt into a hive of undead? How could ye resist?
<|end_description|>
<|end_quest|>
<|endoftext|>

<|begin_quest|>
<|begin_objective|>
investigate the group_0
<|end_objective|>
<|begin_tasks|>
meet character_1
<|end_tasks|>
<|begin_task_locations|>
the sewers
<|end_task_locations|>
<|begin_quest_giver|>
quest_giver: a cleric of character_0_0
<|end_quest_giver|>
<|begin_rewards|>
the player will be rewarded if they serve well
<|end_rewards|>
<|begin_characters|>
character_0_0, character_0_1, character_0_2: the god of order
character_1: a male paladin of character_2, and an ally of character_0_0, who will assist the player in finding the group_0, located at the sewers
character_2: the god of duty
<|end_characters|>
<|begin_groups|>
group_0: a cult that promotes blindness
<|end_groups|>
<|begin_tools|>
blindness is abhorrent to character_0_0
the group_0 is hiding in the sewers: the player must infiltrate the sewers and find a hidden passage leading to the group_0
<|end_tools|>
<|begin_description|>
The task I ask will be treacherous, but you seem capable. Serve well, and you will be rewarded. Display any treachery, and it will be seen. Now to the task.
A cult of the eyeless has emerged: character_0_1 must know of this cult. The blindness they promote is abhorrent to character_0_0. We ask you to investigate and identify the cult.
character_0_2 informs us that the cult is underground and close, but we cannot see past the sewers. You must infiltrate it, as friend or conqueror. You must suffer the filth of the sewers to find the filth of the cult. They are not hiding amidst the pipes, so there must be a passage leading further away.
Our resources are thin at the moment, but an ally of character_0_0 and servant of character_2 is awaiting you in the sewers now. Seek character_1 to serve with you. Faith guide you both.
<|end_description|>
<|end_quest|>
<|endoftext|>

<|begin_quest|>
<|begin_objective|>
decide who gets to marry character_0
<|end_objective|>
<|begin_tasks|>
go see character_0 and her two suitors
<|end_tasks|>
<|begin_task_locations|>
NONE
<|end_task_locations|>
<|begin_quest_giver|>
the majordomo of the player's castle, located at the player's castle
<|end_quest_giver|>
<|begin_rewards|>
NONE
<|end_rewards|>
<|begin_characters|>
character_0: a female maid, located at the player's castle
<|end_characters|>
<|begin_groups|>
group_0: the former rulers of the player's castle
<|end_groups|>
<|begin_tools|>
the player is a noble
character_0 was an orphan who was took in by the group_0: the player is character_0's guardian as the ruler of the keep
no one can marry character_0 without the player's permission
<|end_tools|>
<|begin_description|>
Greetings, Your Grace. It is I, the majordomo of your castle. We have a small problem here at the keep, one that I doubt that you would be aware of at all.
I am unsure if you have met character_0... She has been a maid here most of her life. She was an orphan, and the group_0 took her in as a servant when she was young. As the ruler of the keep, you are technically her guardian. Ordinarily, that would not be a problem, but there are two men who desire her hand in marriage. It is... up to you, my liege, to give her away and decide which of the men has your blessing for the marriage.
I shall bring them in to see you, my liege. If you do not resolve this issue, then... no one shall be permitted to marry character_0. And I am sure that is not what she wants.
<|end_description|>
<|end_quest|>

<|end_rewards|>

<|end_groups|>
<|begin_tools|>
the player is a member of the group_0
group_1 has invaded Amnian lands
<|end_tools|>
<|begin_description|>
Welcome. I, quest_giver, have been awaiting you. You should know the particulars of your service here and what being a member of the group_0 really means.
You are aware of the conflict with the group_1? There have been invasions into Amnian lands. We have been monitoring outposts, and all is not well. One outpost reported an imminent attack because an enemy unit needed their supplies. A runner barely made it with the information, and we fear the worst.
You must leave immediately for the furthest lengths of the task_location_0. You must join the combat and rescue our knights, for they are surely outnumbered.
Go, and rescue whom you can. You have little time.
<|end_description|>

<|begin_quest|>
<|begin_objective|>
return item_0 to the temple of character_0_0
<|end_objective|>
<|begin_tasks|>
intercept the thieves transporting item_0
<|end_tasks|>
<|begin_task_locations|>
the slums at night
<|end_task_locations|>
<|begin_quest_giver|>
quest_giver: priest of character_0_0, located at temple of character_0_0
<|end_quest_giver|>
<|begin_rewards|>
NONE
<|end_rewards|>
<|begin_characters|>
character_0_0, character_0_1: the good god of dawn
character_1: an evil god
<|end_characters|>
<|begin_items|>
item_0: a ring
<|end_items|>
<|begin_groups|>
group_0: followers of character_1
thieves
<|end_groups|>
<|begin_tools|>
there are many new artworks and aged relics on display at the temple of character_0_0
item_0 was stolen from the temple of character_0_0
the thieves were hired by the group_0 of temple of character_1
<|end_tools|>
<|begin_description|>
Good day, it's quest_giver, the priest of character_0_0.
I would ask a dangerous thing of you. You're free to refuse, but the greater glory of character_0_0 is at stake.
The character_0_1 takes great pride in the artifacts of his rule. We have many items on display at the temple of character_0_0, from new artworks to the aged relics of bygone days. Today we are one less. We are the victims of thievery, and our followers have been shaken by this vulnerability. Quick steps must be taken to rectify this.
We know the culprits; they have not concealed their crime. group_0, slinking from their temple to degrade our worship, hired common thieves for the deed! They fear no retribution. The character_0_1 cannot suffer his relics in the hands of such evil.
Find these thieves before the group_0 receive the items.
The spark of dawn has lit the way.
Go to the filth of the slums at night and intercept the delivery of our item_0. Bring it back to its proper place.
<|end_description|>
<|end_quest|>

<|begin_quest|>
<|begin_objective|>
recover quest_giver's fishing rod
<|end_objective|>
<|begin_tasks|>
find the enemy_0 that swallowed quest_giver's fishing rod, and kill it
<|end_tasks|>
<|begin_task_locations|>
an ocean monument: a dangerous underwater temple made out of turquoise stone blocks, located far south of location_0
<|end_task_locations|>
<|begin_quest_giver|>
quest_giver: an annoyed fisherman, located at location_0
<|end_quest_giver|>
<|begin_rewards|>
enough cooked salmon to last the player's lifetime
<|end_rewards|>
<|begin_enemies|>
enemy_0: one-eyed, large, pale, evil pufferfish that can shoot laser, and make the player fatigued when the player is near them
<|end_enemies|>
<|begin_locations|>
location_0: a fishing village
<|end_locations|>
<|begin_tools|>
the player is an enemy of quest_giver
<|end_tools|>
<|begin_description|>
I just escaped with my life from a friggin' enemy_0, and now I run into you, my least favorite person in the whole world.
The damn enemy_0 swallowed the hook, line, and sinker of my fishing rod while I was out in the sea fishing on my boat. It must have eaten the whole fishing rod after it slipped from my grip into the sea.
I shouldn't have gone fish so close to the ocean monument far south of this village. I just couldn't see the turquoise stones that make up the monument before it was too late. Who even built those dangerous underwater temples anyway?
I have a proposition for you: recover my fishing rod from the enemy_0, and I'll set you up with enough cooked salmon to last your lifetime. We might even become friends. First, you have to find the enemy_0, and kill it.
enemy_0 are one-eyed, large, pale, evil pufferfish. They can shoot laser, and make you fatigued when you get close to them.
<|end_description|>
<|end_quest|>

It is said to be full of treasure! And some highly lethal traps that are too much to overcome for a meager researcher like me. There are also rumors that say that the ancients had useful devices lost to time. I'd love to get my hands on one, for science.

The problem is I don't have the materials for making pistons, or the know-how to craft them. This is where you enter the picture. Craft number_0 pistons, and then bring them to me. I know that you need number_2 wooden planks, number_3 cobblestone, an iron ingot, and item_0 for crafting a piston.
Some quarts pillars broke while we were transporting them. You could have the remaining number_1 reward_0 from them.

Alas, my life was turned upside down one fateful day: my ship sank, and I washed up to the shore. A kind villager from this very village found me and helped me regain my strength. I left my pirate days behind, and settled down in location_0.
However, I'd still like to obtain my notebook from those days: I accidentally dropped it into the last treasure chest we buried into the ground. My adventuring days are over: you, however, are known to do odd tasks of more or less adventurous nature to others. I'll give you my treasure map: it will lead you to the buried treasure.
You may keep the buried treasure to yourself, I just ask you to give me my notebook.

group_0 have been bothering us for ages: we villagers are not fighters; we can't hold our own against those bloodthirsty brigands. I want you to sow distrust among their ranks: make them fight amongst themselves.
I already have a plan for you to follow. There are two group_0 captains, character_1 and character_0, who do not exactly see eye to eye. You should go to the group_0 camp to the northeast, and pinch character_1's axe without being seen. Then, move on to the group_0 outpost to the north of here, kill character_0, and plant character_1's axe on character_0's body. character_1 is known to be quick to anger: character_0's men will go after him, for they will assume that character_1 killed their leader.
Do this grueling task, and I'll have something highly valuable for you.

<|begin_description|>
item_0
by quest_giver

Long have I sought to purge the evils haunting character_0. Even when his necromantic studies resulted in our mutual expulsion from the Guild of Mages, I persisted in guiding him towards good with a gentle hand. Alas, in our exile, my old friend has mired himself in the foul practice, and in shocking discovery I learned he had become a miserly disciple of the Worm King, a cunning wraith. A Lich.
Frail memory strengthened by dogmatic resolve, the Archmages turned me away when I came to them with my discovery. My pleas for a detachment of battlemages ignored, only my long-past expulsion remembered. And thus, the grave duty falls only to me. I must bear the burden of purging the Lich that was once a friend.
I wander now into the foreboding maw of these catacombs known as the task_location_0, far from the climes of common elves and men. With pure spirit and rites of cleansing, I hope to strike down the fearsome Lich and set free the soul of character_0, but I leave this testament behind, lest I may never return from these depths; as a warning to those who may follow my path.
Faithful, even in Exile,
quest_giver

complete your induction into the group_0 by creating your own staff
<|end_objective|>
<|begin_tasks|>
speak to character_0 or character_1, and choose wisely
<|end_tasks|>
<|begin_task_locations|>
the grove, to the northeast of the Imperial City, near Wellspring Cave
<|end_task_locations|>
<|begin_quest_giver|>
quest_giver: the player's superior in the group_0
<|end_quest_giver|>
<|begin_rewards|>
the player's own mage staff
<|end_rewards|>
<|begin_characters|>
character_0: a female mage
character_1: a female mage
<|end_characters|>
<|begin_groups|>
group_0: a guild of mages
<|end_groups|>
<|begin_tools|>
several mages tend the grove
<|end_tools|>
<|begin_description|>
Before you can begin work for the guild, you'll need to do something for yourself. Every mage carries a staff. It is crafted and enchanted by the guild, and is a symbol of status. You need such a staff.
The wood used for staves comes from a grove to the northeast of the Imperial City, near Wellspring Cave. Several mages tend to the grove, and should be able to assist you. Speak with either character_0 or character_1 when you arrive.
And choose wisely.
<|end_description|>
<|end_quest|>

If you are true to the teachings of character_0, it may be possible for you to find the reward_0.
When the Order crumbled, I set out on my own. After years of searching, I found the Shield and brought it to task_location_0 for safe keeping. With the help of a few trusted friends, I began work to keep the Shield safe for all eternity. I never saw my work finished. I died defending the fort from those who would take and misuse the Shield. I never saw our work finished; I trust that the others carried on without me.
The fort lies in the southeast of location_0, near the location_1 border. If all went according to plan, it should be very well guarded now.

<|begin_quest|>

<|end_tools|>

Thinking you know how to use a shield is one thing. Actually using one is quite another. So here's what we're going to do. We're going to find out whether or not you can hold up in combat. You put up your shield, and I hit you. If you're still standing when I'm done, you've earned the right to learn what I have to teach.
Shall we find out what you really know? Now, put up your guard, and let's begin. I'm losing interest in this.
<|end_description|>

I confess I have a weakness for crystals of a magical nature, and I must add these to my collection. This is a personal errand, you must understand. Just between you and I. The group_0 has nothing to do with it.
The Tears are not just a namesake. They're literally the frozen tears of a knight named character_1 who lived many years ago. I'm not certain what happened to the knight, or why the tears were frozen, but I do know someone you could ask. Seek out character_0 at the task_location_0 in the location_0. She oversees the Alchemy Headquarters there. If anyone can help you get more information on about these crystals, she can.

<|begin_quest|>

<|end_rewards|>

the player was sent by the character_0
the player will be quest_giver's Grand Inquisitor
<|end_tools|>

You're the one the character_0 sent, aren't you? Then you're safe for now. Speak to no one unless I instruct you to. None of them can be trusted. Do you hear me? None! Surrounded by traitors and spies, I am. Always, always. They watch and wait, eager to slip a knife into my spine when I'm not looking.
Could be all of them. Every last one. None can be trusted. But they'll never take me down. Never! I'll see them all rotting in shallow graves before I let my guard down! You... you will help me. Yes, yes. You will be most useful.
You're going to find out who knows. You're going to learn who keeps secrets, who conspires against me. You will be my Grand Inquisitor. Expose the conspirators, and they will be punished, I assure you. Find out who keeps secrets, and what they are. Speak with character_1. He will help you. Do you understand what is required of you? If no one is found, you will be held responsible.

<|begin_quest|>
<|begin_objective|>
report to quest_giver's steward after finding a cure for vampirism
<|end_objective|>
<|begin_tasks|>
find the witch of group_0
<|end_tasks|>
<|begin_task_locations|>
along the location_0, east of the location_4 and south of location_1
<|end_task_locations|>
<|begin_quest_giver|>
quest_giver: Count of location_3, located at location_3
<|end_quest_giver|>
<|begin_rewards|>
a cure for vampirism
quest_giver will reward the player in whatever small way he can
<|end_rewards|>
<|begin_characters|>
character_0: quest_giver's wife, located at location_3
the witch of group_0, the last remaining group_0 witch in location_2, a woman, located at along the location_0 river
<|end_characters|>
<|begin_groups|>
group_0: a coven of witches
<|end_groups|>
<|begin_locations|>
location_0: a river in location_2
location_1: a city in location_2
location_2: a province
location_3: a city in location_2
location_4: the capital city of location_2
<|end_locations|>
<|begin_tools|>
the player has not met quest_giver before: the player and quest_giver are both looking for a cure for vampirism
over number_0 years ago character_0 and quest_giver were turned into vampires: quest_giver embraced the vampirism, character_0 did not
character_0 slipped into coma from refusing to feed herself: quest_giver wants to cure character_0's vampirism
quest_giver cannot risk drawing too much attention on himself by searching for a cure to vampirism by himself: he found out that witches of group_0 have made a cure for vampirism before
<|end_tools|>
<|begin_description|>
I'm sorry. We've not met. I'm quest_giver, Count of location_3. I understand you're looking for a cure for vampirism. This is fortunate, as I also seek the cure.
I wish to tell you a story so that you might understand why I would trust you with my secrets. More than number_0 years ago, my wife character_0 and I were both turned into vampires. While I came to embrace the changes in myself, she did not. She hated what she had become, and refused to feed to keep herself healthy. She eventually slipped into a coma from which she has not awoken. My trusted servants have cared for her all this time, but I wish for her to at last find peace. The cure is for her. I have researched what I can, but acquiring the cure is beyond my grasp. I cannot risk drawing too much attention to myself. So I would ask that you took up the search on my behalf. If you are successful, I will reward you in whatever small way I can. Will you aid me?
What little I have discovered points to the witches of group_0. In the past, they have been capable of creating a cure. I have searched for these witches throughout location_2, but no covens still exist within its borders. There may be one left. I have unconfirmed reports of a woman seen near the location_0 river, who fits the description of these witches. Seek her out, and learn whether she can help. She lives somewhere along the river, east of the location_4 and south of location_1. If you are successful in finding a cure, report to my steward. You have my thanks.
<|end_description|>
<|end_quest|>

They took myself and character_0, the task_location_0's owner, hostage and put the ship to sea. I have no idea what they're after. If you can get me safely to the top deck, I can steer the task_location_0 home. But I'm not budging until the coast is clear. I'm used to dealing with drunken louts, not a gang of well-armed thieves.

<|end_tasks|>
<|begin_task_locations|>

<|end_rewards|>

<|end_locations|>

<|end_tools|>

Time is against us, and our enemies grow stronger. There is much to do, and little time in which to do it. Your next task is essential.
Word has been sent that the Necromancers have been quite busy, creating black soul gems for their master. In particular, a unique Black Soul Gem has been crafted in the south of location_0, in the ruins of task_location_0.
This gem needs to be confiscated and brought here, before it can be delivered to the character_0 and used against us. I have need of it. I believe the Black Soul Gem  may be instrumental in saving our guild. I will explain once you have returned with it. Until then, discussion is useless.
A contingent of Battlemages has been sent to the site. I would like you to oversee their actions on my behalf. The only thing that matters is that gem. Do you understand? Once you have it safely in your possession, return here immediately.
Know that you have my complete confidence. I would not entrust this job to you if I did not feel you were prepared for it. Now, go.
<|end_description|>

<|begin_quest|>
<|begin_objective|>
perform an ancient ritual to wake the character_1 from her slumber, and seek her guidance
<|end_objective|>
<|begin_tasks|>
1) ask about the character_1 from quest_giver between number_0 PM and 3:00 AM
2) go to the character_1's home with quest_giver
<|end_tasks|>
<|begin_task_locations|>
1) task_location_0, a farm
2) task_location_1, a city
<|end_task_locations|>
<|begin_quest_giver|>
quest_giver: Speaker for the group_1, located at task_location_0
<|end_quest_giver|>
<|begin_rewards|>
NONE
<|end_rewards|>
<|begin_characters|>
character_0: a male Speaker of the group_1, who betrayed the group_0 for some reason, located at task_location_0
character_1: an immortal female spirit who is revered and worshiped by the group_0, located at task_location_1
<|end_characters|>
<|begin_groups|>
group_0: a guild of assassins
group_1: the governing body of the group_0
<|end_groups|>
<|begin_tools|>
the player is a Silencer of the group_0
as the player can see, the group_1 have dealt with character_0
character_0 tricked the player to kill the group_1 off: the player killed the Listener and the Listener's successor
quest_giver promotes the player to Speaker from Silencer: the player becomes a member of the group_1
there are only five members of the group_1, including the player
<|end_tools|>
<|begin_description|>
Silencer! At last you've arrived! Fear not, for the crisis that has threatened the group_0 has finally come to an end. I am quest_giver, Speaker for the group_1.
As you can see, we have dealt with the betrayer, character_0! No longer will you serve as his puppet! It seems character_0 wanted revenge against the group_0 for some reason, and used you to do his dirty work. But now, we can begin anew!
I bestow upon you the title of Speaker. You will take character_0's place on the group_1! Welcome! As you know, the group_1 is now in a state of disarray. character_0 ordered you to kill us off! We five, including you, are now all that remain. Even worse, you killed the Listener! The group_1 without a Listener is like a hand with no thumb. Even the Listener's successor is dead!
So, we have no choice but to invoke an ancient ritual. We must wake the character_1 from her slumber, and seek her guidance! Between the hours of midnight and 3:00 AM, ask me about the character_1, and we will away to our Lady's home in task_location_1. Only then will the ritual begin.
May the character_1 hold you in her cold embrace.
<|end_description|>
<|end_quest|>

<|begin_quest|>

<|end_objective|>

<|end_tasks|>
<|begin_task_locations|>

<|end_task_locations|>
<|begin_quest_giver|>
quest_giver: the player's superior in the group_0
<|end_quest_giver|>
<|begin_rewards|>
a bonus if the player kills character_0 in the manner specified without killing character_1
<|end_rewards|>

<|end_tools|>
<|begin_description|>

Enter secretly and avoid his manservant, character_1. On the second floor is a secreted door leading to a crawlspace. Inside are the fastenings of a mounted head that hangs over character_0's favorite chair. Loosen the fastenings any night between 8:00 pm and 11:00 pm, and the head will surely fall on character_0 as he relaxes in his chair, as is custom. If character_0 is killed in any other manner, or if the manservant character_1 is killed, you will forfeit the bonus.
Now go, and may Death be with you.

Selling all sorts of merchandise, character_0 undercuts prices like you wouldn't believe. He doesn't always sell what we sell, but it is still a problem. People who buy tend to want to spend their money there. That leaves none for us. It's getting so bad, a few of us may have to close up shop. He outright refuses to join the Society or even discuss the matter. We are convinced he is up to no good.

<|begin_description|>
item_0
by quest_giver

Are you ready to get your hands dirty, Silencer?
Your next target is a Khajiit nobleman by the name of character_0, who can be found at his home in the city of location_0. character_0 was recently offered the hand of a prominent location_1 noble's daughter, but turned down the offer when he learned of the girl's rather negligible dowry. The girl's family is outraged, of course, and has hired the group_0 to make character_0 pay for his insolence.
Go to character_0's house in location_0 and end his miserable life. But be warned! The Khajiit is rich and bored, and spends most of his time honing his skills in unarmed combat. Any opponent who can kill with merely his hands is not to be trifled with, so tread carefully. Even worse, character_0 is aware someone may be trying to kill him, and has bribed the guards not to interfere if a fight should spill out into the city streets.

Another mortal dares to summon me, quest_giver, and already I am bored. But enough about me. Let's talk about you.
I could turn you into a goat. Or a puddle. Or a bad idea. I could make you eat your own fingers. Or fall in love with a cloud. Perhaps I could make you into something useful. Let's find out.
There's a little settlement called task_location_0. It's a nice, peaceful place... and dull, dull, dull. You're going to make their lives interesting. They're a superstitious bunch. Everything is an omen or a portent. Let's make one come true. Find their shaman and ask about the item_0 prophecy. You are to find a way to make the first two parts of the prophecy come true. I'll take care of the rest, because it's the most fun. Now, run along.
<|end_description|>

item_0
by quest_giver

I guess you found the message I told you about, old friend. We've traveled together for so long, and you're the only one I trust with the ring and my story.
I knew climbing into the window of that wizard's house was a mistake, but the bounty on the ring was just too enticing to pass up. They said it was worth thousands of drakes... enough to keep me comfortable for a while as I lay low. They also said the owner of the ring was out of town at some meeting of wizards or some such.
They were wrong on both counts. You'd think I'd be used to this by now, dealing with the unpredictable in our line of work. But after trying to fence the ring all over the realm, no one would touch it. Worse still, the wizard was pursuing me the entire time. I had to call in many favors to stay one step ahead of him.
I decided to strike north and make for the neighboring land. As I was crossing the location_0, he finally caught up to me. Two fireballs later, I found myself tumbling down a steep snowy slope into a valley. Don't know where I am, but there are ruins of some old fort here. Luckily, that fetcher didn't follow me down; I assume he gave me up for dead.
I think I'm going to stash the ring in this valley, cross the border north, and return later when I feel it's safe. I've used some old chests I found in the ruins to make sure nobody stumbles across the ring by mistake; you know, the old key to a key thing like we used to do. If I don't make it back here, and you're reading this message, then the ring is all yours, my friend. Use it well and remember me.
quest_giver

item_0
by quest_giver

How to summarize a lifetime of research? So little of what I have learned matters now - the petty politics of ancient times, the age-long campaign to wipe out all mention of the character_0 name.
In the opening days of the First Era, the character_0 was revered throughout the north. Wisdom, wealth, honor, and power were his, and even the legendary heros' heirs sought his counsel.
Smothered by his shadow, character_0's three sons grew cruel and resentful. They lusted after their father's power and prestige, and eventually character_2, the eldest, discovered its source: a mysterious amulet, from which he never parted. Together, they conspired to murder their father in his sleep and divide his amulet between them. And so it was done.
Consumed by their newfound power, the brothers laid waste to the surrounding villages. So great was the carnage that the High King himself intervened, sending a company of battlemages led by the character_4 to subdue the brothers. And after a devastating battle, the three fled the field.
character_1, the youngest, was run to ground in task_location_0, the ancient barrows at the foot of location_0. character_4 pursued character_2 to the shattered crypts of task_location_1, half-buried even then. And at last, character_3 was cornered in the southernmost reaches of land and later entombed in task_location_2.

I just hope those two go easy on character_0 while I'm gone.
Oh gods. Oh gods why? I returned home to find my beautiful character_0 killed and this thing, this horrible bug-like creature ransacking our home. I managed to kill the damned thing, I think it might be a demon! I've never seen anything like it! Oh gods poor character_0. It must have come out of the cellar. Wear this armor and plant this note on the victim.
The people will put pressure on the group_0 who are apparently murdering their fellows without provocation. Their focus will be shifted from us, giving us one less nuisance to deal with.
